website_summaries.verdict: Cordless trimmer that includes premium battery life with zero pull cords.
pros: Gas performance results are guaranteed even though it's battery powered
Weighing almost 22 pounds, this beast will get through all your overgrown yard areas
Two-line spool and Hi-Low speed options are added benefits

customer_reviews.title: this is by far the best one. Best features
customer_reviews.text: Owned 3 trimmers on my lifetime, this is by far the best one. Best features: Long battery life, 2 line spool instead of 1, low vs hi speed, cut a path of long grass/weeds like a hot knife thru butter. Only things that would make it even better: Ability to adjust the length of the trimmer and the ability for the head to turn to use as an edger
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Schommer

customer_reviews.title: Seems good. 40V discontinued.
customer_reviews.text: I have concerns about long-term support for 40V, but it's a good tool. Getting the spool off was more difficult than it's supposed to be. I let a string get real short, and it slipped inside the cutter head. Won't make that mistake again, but not looking forward to changing line. WD40 in the right place might have helped. The 6Ah and 7.5Ah batteries are great. 4Ah gives me less than half the run time of either.
customer_reviews.author: Curmudgeon 23

customer_reviews.title: When it’s time to replace the gas trimmer...
customer_reviews.text: Almost as good as my gas Stihl trimmer. I’ll use this for 90% or more of my 3 acre yard (too hilly and steep for a brush mower or pull behind). Amazing battery life on low and I only need high for the super thick and tall grass or the berries (more shrub than weeds). Love how quiet it is and how easy it is to maneuver. Wish it had a shoulder strap but will likely repurpose the one off my Stihl now that I will use it so infrequently.
customer_reviews.author: Shoe dude

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this unit, but looking for a quickfeed replacement head!
customer_reviews.text: Love the weedeater but desperately looking for a quickfeed universal trimmer head. Another review mentioned the Tanaka head which I did purchase. That head is not compatible with my weedeater. I had the local dewalt dealer look at it also. Maybe the design has changed. An old dewalt part number of DWO1DT995 was given to me as a quickfeed head, however dewalt is no longer making that.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Collier

customer_reviews.title: Works like a pro grade tool.
customer_reviews.text: I whacked my whole property; 3 buildings, inside and outside of 2 large fences, edged the driveway, on a full charge. 1/2 hour straight, and it showed no sign of slowing down. It's a champ even through some heavy weeds. And to not have to worry about gas mixtures and clogged carburators; I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what is more disappointing the tool or support. All my major tools are Dewalt very pleased. Within 5 minutes of using the racket for the first time all the plastic wrapped tightly around the head. Called support nothing. Tried it again rewrapping the spool same thing. Tried online support never heard back. Sending it back today
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cordless trimmer. The battery lasted long enough to trim my large yard. The string did get pinched in the spool a couple of times, but I believe it was wound onto the spool incorrectly at the factory.
customer_reviews.author: JRohde65

customer_reviews.title: Really bad investment
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool. Heart broken. After i spent big$ on special tools and 40 volt batteries, they discontinue the line. Beware of wasting too much money of Dewalt products. Should have done black and decker.
customer_reviews.author: JCarpenter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is a beast! It handles both edging and high grass, no problem. The low throttle setting is great for edging around the house.
customer_reviews.author: mwzztiger08

customer_reviews.title: I gone through two gas trimmers in three years from ...
customer_reviews.text: I gone through two gas trimmers in three years from the big box stores, what a pleasure it is to not mix fuel and store it!
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Love it...
customer_reviews.text: Have a gas trimmer but use this one 99% of the time. I have a lot of trimming on 2 acres.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Fox

customer_reviews.title: No Gas!!!
customer_reviews.text: NO GAS NEEDED!!! Cuts just like a gas powered trimmer!
customer_reviews.author: PawelD_Roc

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt weed cutter
customer_reviews.text: Works well. My husband would like to try with heavier line to make it more effective. It is way to heavy for my arms. Heavy for him.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing but not really made for shorter people. I can work it but it is too long for my kid. Puts the head at a bad up angle
customer_reviews.author: shaun tobin

customer_reviews.title: easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trimmer. wish i purchased this a long time ago. just grab and start trimming.
customer_reviews.author: johnny570

customer_reviews.title: No more small engine carburetor  maintenance
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the power it's a beast but I didnt realize the battery is like no other dewalt batteries they rare not compatible not even with the flex 60volt
customer_reviews.author: Jps

product_meta.title: DEWALT DCST990X1 40V String Trimmer 7.5AH
product_meta.description: The DEWALT DCST990X1 40V Max XR 15" cordless string trimmer features a patented gear drive design for Amplified torque when powering through overgrowth. A high-efficiency Brushless motor maximizes run time & motor life, with a 7.5Ah premium high capacity battery (25% more run time than the 6.0Ah Dcb406). the bump feed head provides 15" of swath with DEWALT 0.080" line (DEWALT 0.095" line is also compatible). the variable Speed trigger offers precise power control as well as performance & runtime management with the hi/Lo Speed control switch. Part of the 40V Max system of outdoor power equipment. Backed by dewalt's 3 year limited warranty. Includes: 1) Dcst990 string trimmer, 1) 40V Max 7.5Ah lithium installation battery, 1) standard charger, 1) 0.080" line pre-wound in Spool.
feature_bullets: 15" cutting Swath with 0.080" line (also accepts DEWALT 0.095" line)
High-efficiency Brushless motor maximizing run time and motor life
Variable trigger with HI/lo speed control for added power or extended runtime
7.5Ah Premium high capacity Battery (25% more run time than the 6.0Ah Dcb406)
Gear drive design that powers through overgrowth

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars28 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
